articles.title: Lenovo’s rollable laptop is the coolest computer I’ve used all year
articles.description: Part of me still can't believe it, but Lenovo did the thing: it took a bonkers concept for a laptop with a rollable screen and built the tech into something you can actually own and use like a normal computer. Except, as conventional as the ThinkBook Plus Gen 6 can be, it's far from a […]

articles.title: Resolving digital threats 100x faster with OpenAI

articles.title: ChatGPT launches study mode to encourage ‘responsible’ academic use
articles.description: Tool gives guidance rather than serving up complete essays or answers, amid rising AI misuse at universities ChatGPT is launching a “study mode” to encourage responsible academic use of the chatbot, amid rising cases of misuse of artificial intelligence tools at universities.The feature, which can be accessed via the chatbot’s tools button, can walk users through complex subjects in a step-by-step format akin to an unfolding academic lesson. Continue reading...
articles.author: Dan Milmo Global technology editor
articles.content: Tool gives guidance rather than serving up complete essays or answers, amid rising AI misuse at universities ChatGPT is launching a “study mode” to encourage responsible academic use of the chatbot, amid rising cases of misuse of artificial intelligence tools at universities.The feature, which can be accessed via the chatbot’s tools button, can walk users through complex subjects in a step-by-step format akin to an unfolding academic lesson. Continue reading...

articles.title: A satellite just used AI to make its own decisions in space — and NASA’s stoked
articles.description: For the first time, a satellite has used onboard AI to autonomously decide where and when to capture a scientific image — all in under 90 seconds, with no human input. The technology, called Dynamic Targeting, was tested by NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) earlier this month. It was installed aboard a briefcase-sized satellite built and operated by UK-based startup Open Cosmos, and carried a machine learning processor developed by Dublin-based firm Ubotica. In the test, the satellite...
articles.author: Siôn Geschwindt
articles.content: For the first time, a satellite has used onboard AI to autonomously decide where and when to capture a scientific image — all in under 90 seconds, with no human input. The technology, called Dynamic Targeting, was tested by NASA’s Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) earlier this month. It was installed aboard a briefcase-sized satellite built and operated by UK-based startup Open Cosmos, and carried a machine learning processor developed by Dublin-based firm Ubotica. articles.title: Harvard’s ultra-thin chip could revolutionize quantum computing
articles.description: Researchers at Harvard have created a groundbreaking metasurface that can replace bulky and complex optical components used in quantum computing with a single, ultra-thin, nanostructured layer. This innovation could make quantum networks far more scalable, stable, and compact. By harnessing the power of graph theory, the team simplified the design of these quantum metasurfaces, enabling them to generate entangled photons and perform sophisticated quantum operations — all on a chip thinner than...
articles.content: Researchers at Harvard have created a groundbreaking metasurface that can replace bulky and complex optical components used in quantum computing with a single, ultra-thin, nanostructured layer. This innovation could make quantum networks far more scalable, stable, and compact. By harnessing the power of graph theory, the team simplified the design of these quantum metasurfaces, enabling them to generate entangled photons and perform sophisticated quantum operations — all on a chip thinner than...

articles.title: Google Labs Introduces Opal, a Visual Platform for Creating AI Mini-Apps
articles.description: Google Labs has introduced Opal, an experimental no-code tool that enables users to create AI-powered mini-applications through natural language descriptions and a visual workflow editor. By Daniel Dominguez
articles.author: Daniel Dominguez
articles.content: Google Labs has introduced Opal, an experimental no-code tool that enables users to create AI-powered mini-applications through natural language descriptions and a visual workflow editor. By Daniel Dominguez

articles.title: Azure native integration elevates Elastic Cloud Serverless experience
articles.description: We're thrilled to announce a significant leap forward in making Elastic Cloud Serverless even more accessible and powerful for Azure users. With the general availability (GA) of Elastic Cloud Serverless on Azure, we've just released the Azure native integration for Elastic Cloud Serverless. This builds upon our existing Azure native integration for Elastic Cloud Hosted, allowing users to seamlessly discover and manage Elastic Cloud in a way that feels inherently part of the Azure...
articles.author: Piyush Dash,Eric Demers,Greg Crist
articles.content: We're thrilled to announce a significant leap forward in making Elastic Cloud Serverless even more accessible and powerful for Azure users. With the general availability (GA) of Elastic Cloud Serverless on Azure, we've just released the Azure native integration for Elastic Cloud Serverless. This builds upon our existing Azure native integration for Elastic Cloud Hosted, allowing users to seamlessly discover and manage Elastic Cloud in a way that feels inherently part of the Azure...

articles.title: New Report: The Architectural Patterns of Financial AI
articles.description: At Bankwell Bank, a new employee named Sarah works around the clock. She responds to loan applicants via email and SMS in under three minutes, gathers missing documents, and hands a perfectly structured file to her human colleagues. She has re-activated roughly half of the bank’s otherwise lost applicants and saved loan officers 90% ofContinue reading "New Report: The Architectural Patterns of Financial AI" The post New Report: The Architectural Patterns of Financial AI appeared first on...

articles.title: AI Is Quietly Rewriting Work—Here’s What You Need to Know
articles.description: Compound Interest: AI’s Invisible Impact on Productivity and Jobs I’ve learned to tune out the “Are we there yet?” chorus that follows every AI model release. While Twitter debates rage about AGI timelines, something more interesting is happening in the trenches: current foundation models are quietly revolutionizing how knowledge work gets done.
